[{"content":"

Airing on Thursday, June 4, 2015: Stocks tumble with the realization that inflation is not dead ... especially in Europe. More on that. Plus, we talk about the implications of President Obama's admission to Marketplace's Kai Ryssdal that China has put out feelers about joining in on the big trade deal that's currently under negotiation.

description: Airing on Thursday, June 4, 2015: Stocks tumble with the realization that inflation is not dead ... especially in Europe. More on that. Plus, we talk about the implications of President Obama's admission to Marketplace's Kai Ryssdal that China has put out feelers about joining in on the big trade deal that's currently under negotiation.
title: Marketplace Morning Report for Thursday, June 4, 2015
contentencoded: Airing on Thursday, June 4, 2015: Stocks tumble with the realization that inflation is not dead ... especially in Europe. More on that. Plus, we talk about the implications of President Obama's admission to Marketplace's Kai Ryssdal that China has put out feelers about joining in on the big trade deal that's currently under negotiation.
teaser: Airing on Thursday, June 4, 2015: Stocks tumble with the realization that inflation is not dead ... especially in Europe. More on that. Plus, we talk about the implications of President Obama's admission to Marketplace's Kai Ryssdal that China has put out feelers about joining in on the big trade deal that's currently under negotiation.
